channel.title: Forum Member of the Week - 11: NotMiles
channel.description:
![NotMilesBig|500x500](upload://2kys9Ze6ea9KcS0JoPDa4OJb4Kn.jpg) <big> Featured Auxy Artist #11: @NotMiles </big>
He's from Chicago and a British citizen. He used to be called 'Kilometers' and made music using with the Figure app & by blowing hard into a trombone. Nowadays, he basically lives here in the Auxy Disco and makes Auxy music while the trombone gathers dust.
The upside-down ginger cat is named 'Cooper', apparently. Although the dangling be-spectacled feline could equally be called 'NotMiles'. Of course, technically speaking: - **WE. ARE. ALL. NOTMILES**. Unless your name happens to be 'Miles', in which case you are probably... 'NotNotMiles'.
And guess who won the highly-coveted Auxy Star Wars Beat-The-Clock Challenge? Yep, NotMiles.
**Week starting: 12 Mar, 2018.** - Please listen to at least one of their tracks (or more) - Provide at least one Soundcloud comment / feedback about their music during their week. - Comment in this thread once you've provided any feedback. - If you want people to comment on your week, remember to comment for others!
Check out the tracks here: https://soundcloud.com/not_miles/tracks
Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/6yVH1gYXjg4IpARV7b1GTC
If you want to be in the weekly draw [add your name.](https://disco.auxy.co/t/forum-member-of-the-week-who-wants-to-be-involved/5518)
![NotDogFood|178x178](upload://zNZzgswB9nr4apBpFfbSOBtgmon.jpg)

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 11: NotMiles
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
Alright, left a bunch of comments across your latest tracks. I love how original they are!

That drop you made with Coops was insane. June has always been one of my favorite tracks, so relaxing! Elixirs is quite nice, but I think it might need a little more high-end, but that could just be me. (Yeah it probably is lol). Cinq takes on of my favorite jazz songs to a whole new level.

I love how your tracks are often experimental but you ace the genre every time. Great job, NotMiles.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 11: NotMiles
item.dc:creator: LittleSpikes
item.description:
I think it depends on what you want to make, since you mastered basics.
If you want to try out new genres, listen more of them and get some tips from them.
If you want to polish your works more, studying music theories couly help you.
If you don’t know what to make next, I would like to request you to remix any of your favorite song

And we will always support you to improve your music!

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 11: NotMiles
item.dc:creator: LittleSpikes
item.description:
Ayyy NotMiles!!! My old meme friend from corn field… always nice to chat with you here.
Some of your songs grab my heart and I can’t stop listening to them.
My favorites are June and Cinq.
June, is kinda nostalgic and chill tune which reminds me lots of towns in video games. Repetitive, but I never get tired of it. I even hum the melodies
About Cinq, I fall in love with its jazzy fancy atmosphere, but after listening it multiple times , i really impressed by perfectly constructed melodies. This one is now in my driving playlist.

Look forward to your future songs!

Cooper’s fan

Read full topic
item.source: Forum Member of the Week - 11: NotMiles

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 11: NotMiles
item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
Man, what an artist you are @NotMiles. I love viewing the project files of detailed, complicated works with lots of changes, and I’m almost itching to see how you work. But all good, all good. I’ll let it remain a mystery.

Gotta say, I defs love your moodier works, and by the looks of the above, so does everyone else. I’ll leave as much gushing as I can on your SC, but I wanna say a bit more here.

Quadrant is like listening to a dope medley. Nothing really overstays its welcome, and you really get to show off the versatility of your style.

Elevation: -3600km: First of all, km? An American using the METRIC SYSTEM!? Hehe, I listened to the track at the start of the week when I was tired and I was like, “Man, this is good content. I’m going to have to dedicate a night to this guy.” This is along the lines of something I wish I could make, but you just hit the nail on the head. 7 minutes flew by like it was nothing. I’ll see what the rest of your tracks are like, but I think you’re pretty conscious about maintaining interest throughout a song.

Elixer: MEOW! There’s so much fun here even though it has moody atmospheric synths. I enjoyed the building tension in the middle of the song.

NotMiles X @DHO - Drifting Into The Depths Man, DHO, your piana here is just lovely. NotMiles just gives it all the room in the world to breathe and be beautiful, while maintaining the style underneath to gently re-enter. Just noice.

Corvus was the spookiest track for me. Many appreciations for a good spook. All the playfulness was overwhelmed by the spooky dooky. Almost like an unhappy ending?

June: so gentle, so pretty. Liked it a lot. Can’t be edgy all the time, right?

I’m falling asleep so might have to pick up the rest of your tracks tomorrow. Interested to see how your style changes in your earlier stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 11: NotMiles
item.dc:creator: NotMiles
item.description:
MisterMaster:

Your tracks are so unique, creative and atmospheric.

Thank you so much, @MisterMaster!

MisterMaster:

The first section and title made me think of Bladerunner.

Wow! Thanks! Blade Runner 2049 has been a pretty big inspiration since I saw it, incredible movie.

MisterMaster:

Both parts took me somewhere really good

That’s the goal of my music, to take you somewhere. I’m glad it worked.

MisterMaster:

which left me wondering if they could have been two different tracks.

Yeah, probably.

MisterMaster:

I googled the title for a clue, but unsure if it’s a reference to anything (or any place) in particular?

Sector 29 is definitely made-up, but Elevation: -3,600km is a real place. It’s the world’s deepest mine.

MisterMaster:

Slow, well controlled and gripping. I totally forgot what the title was and was about to add a comment saying “Don’t go in there”, which means you really nailed the title.

Oh my goodness, thank you! (I have no idea what else to say except thank you)

MisterMaster:

You’re excellent at creating a mood & painting a scene with your music every time.

Yay! Thank you!

MisterMaster:

descent into madness. Have you noticed that?

Maybe Auxy is making me crazy, who knows. Maybe I’ve always been this way (Probably the second one)

MisterMaster:

You’ve inspired me to make a sci-fi atmospheric track.

Can’t wait to hear it!

Read full topic
item.source: Forum Member of the Week - 11: NotMiles

item.title: Forum Member of the Week - 11: NotMiles
item.dc:creator: NotMiles
item.description:
Oh man, @Mr_Mooo, what can I even say? Now I can definitely tell why you earned yourself that nice unicorn, you go above and beyond on the feedback!

Mr_Mooo:

OMG JUST HOW DO YOU DO THIS

I honestly couldn’t tell you my thought process for making music. It just happens, I guess.

Mr_Mooo:

This is my favourite auxy song I’ve heard so far.

Thank you! (Looks like 3 weeks of music-making paid off)

Mr_Mooo:

I also love the cat miaow


He says thanks. (Or “feed me”)

Mr_Mooo:

It makes me want to hear more.

Be on the lookout for the next few days wink wink

Mr_Mooo:

I could never imagine any of my music being as good as this.

Keep working hard at it and you’ll be amazing yourself and others with your music.

Mr_Mooo:

You really like experimenting with pith don’t you?

I sure do! =]

Mr_Mooo:

Can I hear some voices in the background of the intro?

Nope, no vocals.

Mr_Mooo:

Your music is so unique! Other producers who are popular do tracks that everyone is doing, but I’ve never really heard any music like yours before by anyone else in the auxy community. It isn’t how most people do a song. The structure is always amazing, and always different and changing and keeping me interested.

Thank you a lot for this comment! I often doubt that a lot of people would like my music because it’s so different, but all of you guys are really changing my mind.

Mr_Mooo:

I love the I think use of silk?

Yep, it’s silk. Love that lead, perfect for T H I C C chords.

Mr_Mooo:

You also like heavy bass don’t you?

You could say that, lol.

Mr_Mooo:

They sound different to your normal chords

How so?

Mr_Mooo:

kinda like ‘you can do it’

I have no idea what this means, but I’m gonna agree with it

Mr_Mooo:

I would’ve done more feedback but I didn’t have the time, sorry. Also sorry if I said awesome too much

Naw man, that was perfect.
Thank you.
Thank you.
Thank you so much.

Read full topic
item.source: Forum Member of the Week - 11: NotMiles

item.description:

Things that I generally don’t think are things made in Auxy

Huge compliment, thank you!!! It’s all 100% Auxy. Thank you for listening @SpaghettiSauce!

SpaghettiSauce:

I feel like the entire Sector 29 set could be a video game soundtrack

Wow! Thank you so much!!! The whole idea for the Sector 29 album is for it to be for a made-up sci-fi video game, so you’re spot-on.
